content:
© 2023 Accordion / CONFIDENTIAL
1
Routing Optimization 
(Apparel Retailer)
Created a Frontline Solver based model to systematically optimize the routing of 
several product sets to sales associates across the U.S. to minimize the total shipping 
cost incurred by the company

© 2023 Accordion / CONFIDENTIAL
Routing Optimization For Pe-owned Apparel Retailer
2
SITUATION
VALUE ADDITION
IMPACT
• Merilytics partnered with the company to develop 
an optimization model to reduce overall product 
shipment costs within its sales force network
INPUTS
• Analyzed the sales network and performance data 
to identify shipment cost drivers and cost-saving 
opportunities
• Developed a complex routing optimization model 
based on the classic multiple Vehicle Routing 
Problem (mVRP) to provided optimal shipment 
routes to minimize logistics costs
• Factored in various business constraints related to 
geographic locations, sales agent performance, 
shopping seasons etc. and automated the route 
output
• Integrated the optimization model with logistics 
provider’s shipping API for the client to develop 
real-time optimized routes
PROCESSING
• Our in-depth analysis and highly scalable 
optimization model allowed the company to 
enhance the efficiency of its product shipment-route 
planning process each season
• Realized higher EBITDA through lower shipment 
costs and shorter planning process
OUTPUTS
ABOUT THE CLIENT: Company is a PE-owned multi-million-dollar apparel brand with strong track record of providing multiple lines of custom-designed products over multiple 
decades

© 2023 Accordion / CONFIDENTIAL
Routing Optimization For PE-owned Apparel Retailer
3
Sales network of ~300 
locations
Objective: Identifying the optimal route that leads to minimal shipping costs and maximum sales in the season
•
Developed a complex routing optimization model 
based on the classic multiple Vehicle Routing Problem 
(mVRP) to provided optimal shipment routes to minimize 
logistics costs
•
Factored in various business constraints related to 
geographic locations, sales agent performance rank, 
availability schedules, and automated the route output
•
Integrated the optimization model with logistics 
provider’s shipping API for the client by writing a Java 
code, which allowed the model to develop real-time 
optimized routes
•
Model typically conducted ~10 million iterations
Four shipments with apparel 
products are sent out each season 
to the sales network
Sales network consists of 300 people across 300 
locations, with the following constraints
• Each seller can receive only one shipment
• Hold product for a week
• Provide availability schedule
• Have different selling capabilities
WAREHOUSE
